questions.question: In "Marian Anderson", why does the author describe Marian's youth?

choices.answer: to show how popular church music was
to show why Anderson became a singer not a violinist
show why African Americans had not yet succeeded musically
to show how Anderson's town supported her growth as a singer

questions.question: Which is true of Marian's career?

choices.answer: She succeeded first in Europe, then in America
She never succeeded in America
She succeeded first in America, then in Europe
She never succeeded in Europe

questions.question: What is the main idea of "Marian Anderson"?

choices.answer: concert performers are the most talented singers
musical talent is not limited to a single race
Europeans are the best judges of good music
a good manager is the key to success in the concert business

questions.question: Which idea is expressed in"Marian Anderson"?

choices.answer: it is painful to lose someone dear  to you
our actions should match our beliefs
there is nothing to learn from the distant past
childhood helps shape who we later become

questions.question: What is one purpose Hughes had for writing his essay?

choices.answer: to express intense emotions
to move their readers to action
to preserve and illustrate a piece of cultural history
to celebrate racial differences
